title: Introducing: Babble
content:
‘Folk’ music has always been a tricky one for me.

I love Bright Eyes, Elliott Smith and Sufjan, but find there’s a very fine line between emotional fragility and vapid, self-indulgence. Thankfully, this debut release from Amanda Goodman, aka Babble, certainly comes in on the right side. Until My Lips Fall Off is ten tracks of touching, ever-so-slightly raw, acoustic gorgeousness, mixing elements of Sharon Van Etten and Bill Callahan amidst her fraught, tender songwriting. Truly, this is a beautiful release. Check out a couple of highlights below and grab UMLFO over at her Bandcamp.

“tell me how the sun tastes,
tell her that i miss her warm skin against my face”
